articles.title: Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Embassies in Dacca and Kuala Lumpur
articles.content:
Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Embassies in Dacca and Kuala Lumpur 
    Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Leaders and heads of various political parties and organizations of Bangladesh including the Workers' Party, the Socialist Party, the Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), the National Socialist Party, the Peace Council and the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship Association under the Left Democratic Front of Bangladesh paid congratulatory visits to the embassy of the DPRK in Dacca on Sept. 5 on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the DPRK.
 They laid a floral basket in the name of the Left Democratic Front of Bangladesh before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the embassy and paid tribute to them.    
 Dilip Barua, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist), said that the DPRK has firmly defended the gains of the socialist revolution for the last nearly 60 years, united close around their great leaders despite the imperialists' moves to isolate and stifle it, adding that the progressive people of Bangladesh are confident that the Korean people will achieve greater victory and prosperity in the days ahead under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
 Meanwhile, figures of various circles including the vice-president of the Malaysian People's Movement, the general manager of the Yangji Travel Agency, the president of the M. K. P. Company of Malaysia and other figures of Malaysia visited the DPRK embassy in Kuala Lumpur to place floral baskets before the portraits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il there and pay tribute to them.

articles.title: Greetings to Brazilian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Brazilian President 
    Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Luiz Inacio Lula Da Silva, president of Brazil, on Sept. 7 on the occasion of its independence day.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries developing on good terms would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the Brazilian president greater success in his work for the country's prosperity.

articles.title: Immediate Pullback of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Demanded
North-South Women's Reunification Forum Held
Greetings to Tajik President
articles.content:
Greetings to Tajik President 
    Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Emomali Rakhmonov, president of Tajikistan, on Sept. 9 on the occasion of its national day.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on better terms and wished the president of Tajikistan greater success in his responsible work for the country's prosperity and welfare of the people.

articles.title: Elimination of Traitorous Forces in S. Korea Called for
Fiction about DPRK's Pursuance of "Uranium Enrichment Program" Refuted
Rodong Sinmun on "Anti-Terrorism War"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on "Anti-Terrorism War" 
    Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The last four years during which the U.S. "anti-terrorism war" has been fought have laid  bare its unjust, deceptive and reactionary nature because it has been nothing helpful to ensuring global peace and social progress, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a signed article.
 Why is the issue of terrorism getting more serious and knotty in this century than the last century and who is chiefly to blame for posing a grave threat to the global peace and stability and disturbing them? The article queries, and continues: 
 The policy of military high-handedness and hegemony aimed to dominate and oppress other countries and nations is the main cause of creating and increasing the world-wide instability and fear of terrorism. The U.S. is chiefly to blame for this.
 As the shocking September 11 incident occurred in the U.S. four years ago, it took the opportunity of declaring a war against terrorism under the pretext of ensuring peace and security in its mainland and the rest of the world. When the "anti-terrorism war" began, the U.S. ruling quarters claimed that it was aimed at "making the world safer".
 But the reality is quite contrary to it. Fear of terrorism is the social symptom tormenting the international community after the start of this war. The world has come to realize that the U.S. anti-terrorism war is nothing but a means of domination as it calls for realizing its wild ambition for U.S.-led globalization by spreading U.S-style "freedom" and "democracy" by force of arms. What is obvious is that the "anti-terrorism war" now being fought by the U.S. under the spurious pretext of "combating terrorism" to realize its wild ambition for dominating the whole world has created the world-wide instability and fear of terrorism.    
 The U.S. "anti-terrorism war" has only aggravated an evil cycle of terrorism and retaliation, destruction and death.    
 The U.S. itself has paid a high price for this "anti-terrorism war". The U.S. society is in the grip of uneasiness and fear that when or where an attack would be made.
 The U.S. would be well advised to give up its aggressive and hegemonic "anti-terrorism war" as it goes against the trend of the times and is rebuffed and denounced by the international community and abandon its wild ambition to dominate the world.

articles.title: U.S. Groundless Smear Campaign under Fire
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Six-Party Talks
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Six-Party Talks
    Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation led by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Kye Gwan left Pyongyang today for Beijing to participate in the six-party talks slated to take place there for the solution of the nuclear issue between the DPRK and the U.S.
 It was seen off at the airport by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Yong Il, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe, Russian Charge d' Affaires a.i. Oleg Davydov and others.

articles.title: KCNA Terms U.S. Kingpin of Human Traffic and Biggest Human Rights Abuser
South Side's Delegation Here
articles.content:
South Side's Delegation Here
    Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The south side's delegation with Jong Tong Yong, minister of Unification, as its chief delegate arrived here Tuesday to participate in the 16th inter-Korean ministerial talks.
 It was greeted at the airport by members of the north side's delegation to the inter-Korean ministerial talks including Choe Yong Gon, vice-minister of Construction and Building-Materials Industries who is the north side's chairman of the North-South Committee for the Promotion of Economic Cooperation.    
 A working woman presented a bouquet to the south side's chief delegate.
 Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, hosted a reception at the People's Palace of Culture Tuesday evening in honor of the south side's delegation.

articles.title: More Sports Facilities Built
New Stamp Issued in DPRK
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from German Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from German Ambassador
    Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from German Ambassador to the DPRK Friedrich Ludwig Loehr at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.
 On hand were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and staff members of the German Embassy here.    
 After receiving credentials, the president conversed with the ambassador.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
    Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the China State Electric Network Corporation headed by its President Liu Zhenya arrived here today to participate in the functions to mark the 50th anniversary of the Korea-China Hydro-Electric Power Company.
 It was greeted at the airport by Sin Yong Song, vice-minister of Electricity and Coal Industries, officials concerned and Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.
 Also arriving here on the same day was Secretary-General of the Asia-Pacific Broadcasting Union David Astley.
